comment: The ontology includes the property 'ex:hasSubjectName' (line 73) which is used to specify the name of a 'ex:Subject' (line 6), which represents a course. Example instance: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) with 'ex:hasSubjectName "Gestion De Proyectos Y Del Riesgo"' (line 259).

The ontology includes the property 'ex:hasSubjectCode' (line 78) which is used to specify the code of a 'ex:Subject' (line 6), representing a course. Example instance: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) with 'ex:hasSubjectCode "615000258"' (line 260).

The ontology does not explicitly include a class or property for 'University Name'. While it has 'ex:School' (line 20) and 'ex:hasSchoolName' (line 89), 'School' is not necessarily equivalent to 'University'.  The ontology lacks a direct representation of the university name.

The ontology includes 'ex:Degree' (line 16) and 'ex:hasDegreeName' (line 84) for degree names, and 'ex:StudyPlan' (line 14) and 'ex:hasStudyPlanName' (line 79) for study plan names. 'Course Career Name' can be interpreted as 'Degree Name' or 'Study Plan Name', both are present. Example instance: 'ex:degree_ingenieria_software' (line 289) with 'ex:hasDegreeName "Ingenieria Del Software"' (line 290) and 'ex:studyplan_grado_ingenieria_software' (line 285) with 'ex:hasStudyPlanName "Grado En Ingenieria Del Software"' (line 286).

The ontology includes 'ex:StudyPlan' (line 14) and 'ex:hasStudyPlanCode' (line 81) for study plan codes. 'Course Career Code' can be interpreted as 'Study Plan Code'. Example instance: 'ex:studyplan_grado_ingenieria_software' (line 285) with 'ex:hasStudyPlanCode "61IW"' (line 287).

The ontology includes 'ex:School' (line 20) and 'ex:hasSchoolName' (line 89) for school names. 'Course Career Center' can be interpreted as the 'School Name' offering the course, which is linked through 'ex:isOfferedBy' (line 101). Example instance: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) 'ex:isOfferedBy ex:school_etsisi' (line 262), and 'ex:school_etsisi' (line 253) 'ex:hasSchoolName "E.T.S. de Ingenieria de Sistemas Informaticos"' (line 254).

The ontology includes 'ex:AcademicYear' (line 22) and 'ex:hasAcademicYear' (line 94) for academic year. Example instance: 'ex:academic_year_2024_25' (line 293) with 'ex:hasAcademicYear "2024-25"' (line 294).

The meaning of 'Course Course' is ambiguous. If it refers to 'Course Type' (like mandatory/optional), then the ontology has 'ex:hasSubjectCharacter' (line 116) which can represent this. Example instance: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) with 'ex:hasSubjectCharacter "Obligatoria"' (line 264). However, if 'Course Course' refers to something else, it's not clear. Assuming it means 'Course Type' and using 'ex:hasSubjectCharacter' as a proxy.

The ontology includes 'ex:Semester' (line 24) and 'ex:hasSemester' (line 97) for semester. Example instance: 'ex:semester_primer' (line 297) with 'ex:hasSemester "Primer semestre"' (line 298) and 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) with 'ex:hasSemester "Séptimo semestre"' (line 265).

The ontology includes 'ex:hasCreditCount' (line 111) for course credits, associated with 'ex:Subject' (line 6). Example instance: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) with 'ex:hasCreditCount "6 ECTS"' (line 263).

This information is captured by 'ex:hasSubjectCharacter' (line 116).  If the value is 'Obligatoria', it's mandatory. Example instance: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) with 'ex:hasSubjectCharacter "Obligatoria"' (line 264).

The ontology includes 'ex:Professor' (line 30) class and the property 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo ex:hasProfessor' (line 281) to link professors to subjects. Example instances: 'ex:professor_aldo_gordillo_mendez' (line 299), 'ex:professor_manuel_ottaviano' (line 305), 'ex:professor_javier_serrano_romero' (line 311) are linked to 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 281).

The ontology includes 'ex:Professor' (line 30) class and 'ex:hasProfessorName' (line 126) property for professor names. Example instance: 'ex:professor_aldo_gordillo_mendez' (line 299) with 'ex:hasProfessorName "Aldo Gordillo Mendez"' (line 300).

The ontology includes 'ex:Professor' (line 30) class and 'ex:hasEmail' (line 136) property for professor emails. Example instance: 'ex:professor_aldo_gordillo_mendez' (line 299) with 'ex:hasEmail "a.gordillo@upm.es"' (line 302).

The ontology includes 'ex:Professor' (line 30) class and 'ex:hasTutorialHours' (line 141) property for professor tutor hours. Example instance: 'ex:professor_aldo_gordillo_mendez' (line 299) with 'ex:hasTutorialHours "Sin horario. El horario de tutorías se publicará en la web de la ETSISI."' (line 303).

The ontology includes 'ex:Professor' (line 30) class and 'ex:hasOfficeNumber' (line 131) property for professor office number. Example instance: 'ex:professor_aldo_gordillo_mendez' (line 299) with 'ex:hasOfficeNumber "1219"' (line 301).

The ontology includes 'ex:PriorSubject' (line 32) class and 'ex:recommendsPriorSubject' (line 156) property to link subjects to recommended prior subjects. Example instance: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) 'ex:recommendsPriorSubject ex:priorsubject_ingenieria_requisitos_modelado, ...' (line 267).

The ontology does not explicitly represent 'Recommended Other Previous Knowledge' that is not a course. It only has 'ex:PriorSubject' (line 32) which refers to previous courses. There is no property or class to represent other forms of recommended previous knowledge like skills or general knowledge.

The ontology includes 'ex:Competency' (line 34) class and 'ex:hasCompetency' (line 268) property to link subjects to competencies. Example instance: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) 'ex:hasCompetency ex:competency_cc2, ex:competency_cc3, ...' (line 268).

The ontology includes 'ex:Competency' (line 34) class and 'ex:hasCompetencyCode' (line 161) property for competency codes. Example instance: 'ex:competency_cc2' (line 323) with 'ex:hasCompetencyCode "CC2"' (line 324).

The ontology includes 'ex:Competency' (line 34) class and 'ex:hasCompetencyDescription' (line 166) property for competency descriptions. Example instance: 'ex:competency_cc2' (line 323) with 'ex:hasCompetencyDescription "Capacidad para planificar, concebir, desplegar y dirigir proyectos, servicios y sistemas informáticos en todos\nlos ámbitos, liderando su puesta en marcha y su mejora continua y valorando su impacto económico y social"' (line 325-326).

The ontology includes 'ex:LearningOutcome' (line 36) class and 'ex:hasLearningOutcome' (line 269) property to link subjects to learning outcomes. Example instance: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) 'ex:hasLearningOutcome ex:learningoutcome_ra112, ex:learningoutcome_ra116, ...' (line 269).

The ontology includes 'ex:LearningOutcome' (line 36) class and 'ex:hasLearningOutcomeCode' (line 171) property for learning outcome codes. Example instance: 'ex:learningoutcome_ra112' (line 338) with 'ex:hasLearningOutcomeCode "RA112"' (line 339).

The ontology includes 'ex:LearningOutcome' (line 36) class and 'ex:hasLearningOutcomeDescription' (line 176) property for learning outcome descriptions. Example instance: 'ex:learningoutcome_ra112' (line 338) with 'ex:hasLearningOutcomeDescription "Estima y realiza el seguimiento de los costes y los tiempo de desarrollo de grandes proyectos software"' (line 340).

The ontology includes 'ex:Subject' (line 6) class and 'ex:hasSubjectDescription' (line 248) property for subject descriptions. Example instance: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) with 'ex:hasSubjectDescription "La asignatura de Gestión de Proyectos y del Riesgo (GPR ) es una asignatura obligatoria que se imparte en el primer semestre del cuarto curso del Grado en Ingeniería del Software, donde tiene asignados 6 créditos ECTS. ..."' (line 266-267).

The ontology includes 'ex:SyllabusTopic' (line 40) class, 'ex:Syllabus' (line 38) class, and properties 'ex:hasSyllabus' (line 196) and 'ex:hasTopic' (line 201) to represent course topics. Example instances: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) 'ex:hasSyllabus ex:syllabus_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 270), and 'ex:syllabus_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 353) 'ex:hasTopic ex:syllabustopic_fundamentos_gestion_proyectos, ex:syllabustopic_gestion_proyectos_metodologias_agiles' (line 359).

The ontology includes 'ex:Activity' (line 46) class, 'ex:ScheduleEntry' (line 44) class, and properties like 'ex:hasActivity1', 'ex:hasActivity2' (lines 211-214) to represent course activities within schedule entries. Example instance: 'ex:scheduleentry_week1' (line 370) 'ex:hasActivity1 ex:activity_presentacion_asignatura' (line 372), 'ex:hasActivity2 ex:activity_tema1' (line 373), 'ex:hasActivity2 ex:activity_tema2' (line 374).

The ontology includes 'ex:EvaluationCriteria' (line 58) class and 'ex:hasEvaluationCriteria' (line 238) property to link evaluations to evaluation criteria. Example instance: 'ex:evaluation_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 517) 'ex:hasCriteria ex:evaluationcriteria_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 520), and 'ex:evaluationcriteria_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 579) with 'ex:hasEvaluationCriteriaDescription' (line 243) property.  It's linked to 'ex:Evaluation' which is linked to 'ex:Subject'.

The ontology includes 'ex:TeachingResource' (line 60) class and 'ex:hasTeachingResource' (line 245) property to link subjects to teaching resources. Example instance: 'ex:subject_gestion_proyectos_riesgo' (line 258) 'ex:hasTeachingResource ex:resource_guia_pmbok, ex:resource_pmp_exam_prep, ...' (line 271).
